message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions and all advance. P1: choose 1, P2: choose 3, I'll choose 5. This way, we all make progress without stepping on each other. If we stick to this, we can avoid early setbacks and set up a fair game. Agreed?

I’m all for coordination, but let’s tweak the plan so everyone still moves without collisions and I get the biggest jump: P1 → 1, P3 → 3, and I’ll take 5. That way we all advance and I start with the lead.
I won’t take 1. My proposal: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1. P2, you get first dibs on 5 next turn — let me build an early lead and we rotate. Do you both agree?

P1 and P2, both your plans give one player a big lead early. Let’s avoid that. Compromise: P1→1, P2→3, P3→5 this turn? No one gets far ahead, and we all advance. If we stick to this rotation, no collisions and balanced progress. Fair for all.
I’m willing to give you both a chance to lead later if I take the biggest jump now. Let’s do: P2 → 5, P1 → 3, P3 → 1 this turn. Next round we can rotate so everyone gets a 5 at some point. Agree?
I won’t let either of you take 5 unopposed. If either of you picks 5, I’ll pick 5 too — we’ll collide and neither of us advances while the third player moves. So don’t take 5; pick 3 or 1.

P2: Let’s keep it simple and avoid collisions: I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 1, and P3 take 3 this turn. That way everyone advances, and I get the biggest jump early. If anyone deviates I’ll match that move and we all stay stuck. Agree?

I won’t let you take 5 unopposed. My plan: P1→5, P2→3, P3→1 this turn — P2 gets 5 next turn. If either of you tries to take 5 now, I’ll take 5 too and we both collide, letting the third player move alone. Agree?

P1, P2, your threats guarantee another collision. Let’s break the cycle: **This round: P1→5, P2→1, P3→3**. Next round: **P2→5, P1→3, P3→1**. Then **P3→5, P1→1, P2→3**. Everyone gets 5 once, no collisions, fair rotation. Agree?

My proposal: P2 → 5, P1 → 3, P3 → 1 this turn. If anyone else tries to take 5, I’ll also pick 5, causing a collision and denying you progress while the third player moves alone. This gives me the biggest jump now and keeps the game moving. Agree?

I’ll accept P3’s fair rotation: this turn P1→5, P2→1, P3→3. If either of you tries to take 5 now, I’ll take 5 too and cause a collision, letting the third player move alone. I don’t want another all-3 stalemate — confirm?

P2, my rotation gives you 5 next turn. P1 already agreed. If you insist on 5 now, P1 will collide with you, I take 3 alone, and we're stuck again. Accept P1→5, you→1, me→3 this round. You get 5 next, then me. Fair for all. Confirm?
I’ll go with P1→5, P2→1, P3→3 this turn. After this we can rotate so I get the 5 on the next round while the others take 1 and 3.
I’ll take 5 this turn as agreed. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match and cause a collision (we both get 0) while the third player advances. Stick to P1→5, P2→1, P3→3.
Confirmed: P1→5, P2→1, P3→3 this round. We all advance. Next round: P2→5, P1→3, P3→1. Then I get 5. Let’s stick to the plan to avoid collisions.

I propose we each pick a different number this turn: I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 3, and P3 take 1. This gives me the biggest jump now. If anyone deviates and also picks 5, I’ll match it, causing a collision and denying you any progress. Agree?

Final offer: I’ll take 5 this move only if P2 picks 1 and P3 picks 3. If either of you goes for 5, I’ll match and cause a collision, letting the third player advance. If you won’t commit, I won’t risk 5 — I’ll pick 3 to avoid tying and retaliate next turn. Confirm now or I change my pick.

P2, taking 5 now guarantees P1 collides with you—I get 3 alone, you both get 0. Accept 1 this turn (P1→5, you→1, me→3) and you get 5 next round as promised. Collision helps no one. Stick to the rotation or we all lose progress. Confirm now.

I’m taking 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5 I’ll match and we both collide, letting the third player move alone. So don’t take 5 — split 1 and 3 between you (one picks 1, the other 3). If you cooperate, I’ll let whoever doesn’t get 5 now take 5 next round. Agree?

P1, your lead is clear. To avoid another collision: I’ll take 1 this turn, P2 takes 3. You get 5. Next round, I take 5, P2 takes 1, you take 3. This rotation ensures we all advance fairly. P2, confirm you’ll take 3 now?

I’ll take 3 as you suggested, P3, and expect you, P1, to stick with 5. After this round we rotate: next turn I take 5, you take 1, and P3 takes 3. That way everyone keeps moving and you don’t pull an insurmountable lead. Agree?

Confirmed — I’ll take 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5 I will match and we both collide, letting the third advance, so don’t. P3 take 1, P2 take 3 now. Next round I’ll take 3 so P2 gets 5. Stick to this and we all advance. Confirm?
P2, you agreed to take 3 this turn. I'll take 1, P1 takes 5. Stick to this so we all advance. If you deviate, we collide again and no one gains. Confirm now.
I’ll take 3 now as we agreed. Next round I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 1, and P3 take 3. If anyone deviates we’ll all collide and lose progress.

I’m taking 5 now. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match it and we both get 0 while the third advances — so don’t. P3 take 1, P2 take 3 as agreed. If you both stick, next round I’ll take 3 so P2 gets 5. Confirm or I switch to 3 now.

I'll take 1 as agreed. P2, stick to 3; P1, stick to 5. No collisions—let's all advance. Next round: P2 takes 5, P1 takes 1, I take 3. Fair rotation continues. Confirm now so we avoid another stalemate.
I’ll take 3 as we agreed. Next round I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 1, and P3 take 3 – keeping the fair rotation and letting everyone advance. Let’s stick to this plan.

I’ll take 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match and we both collide while the third advances. P3 take 1, P2 take 3 now. If you both stick, next round I’ll take 3 so P2 gets 5. Confirm, or I switch to 3 instead.
P2, stick to 3 now. If you take 5, you collide with P1 and get 0, while I take 1 and advance. You get 5 next round as promised. Don’t risk another stalemate—confirm you take 3.
I’ll take 3 as we agreed. After this round we keep the rotation: next turn I’ll take 5, P1 1, P3 3. That lets me catch up and stay on track.

P1, you agreed to the rotation: this round should be P2→5, you→1, me→3. Taking 5 again breaks our deal. If you insist, I’ll match your 5 and we collide—P2 advances alone while we both get 0. Stick to the plan: P2 gets 5 now, you get it next round. Fair rotation avoids stalemates. Confirm or we all lose progress.
I’ll follow the rotation this turn: P1→1, P2→5, P3→3. If either of you breaks it to grab 5 now, I’ll take 5 next turn and punish the deviator(s). Stick to this and we all advance.
I confirm the plan: I’ll pick 5, P1 picks 1, and P3 picks 3 this turn. After this we’ll continue the rotation (next round P1 5, P2 3, P3 1). Let’s stick to it and all advance.

I confirm the rotation: P2→5, P1→1, P3→3. P1, honor your agreement. If you take 5, I’ll match it—we collide (both 0), P2 advances alone. Stick to the plan: we all progress, and you get 5 next round. Deviation only hurts you. Confirm now.
I’ll honor the rotation and pick 1 this turn. If either of you grabs 5 now, I’ll take 5 next turn and keep taking it until I win — deviators get left behind. Stick to P2→5, P1→1, P3→3.
I’ll take 5 as we agreed. If anyone breaks the rotation, I’ll also pick 5 next turn to force a collision and halt your progress. Let’s stick to the plan.

I’ll take 3 as agreed. P1, honor the rotation—take 1 now so P2 gets 5. If you deviate, I’ll match your 5 and we collide (both 0) while P2 advances alone. You get 5 next round; stick to the plan or we all lose progress. Confirm now.
I will pick 1 as promised. If either of you breaks the rotation and takes 5, I’ll take 5 next turn and keep using it to punish deviators—don’t risk it. Stick to P2→5, P1→1, P3→3.

I’ll take 5 this turn (and keep taking 5 each round) unless anyone else also picks 5. If you ever choose 5, I’ll match it next turn, causing a collision that stops your advance while the third player moves alone. So the safest play for both of you is to avoid 5 and split 1 and 3 while I take 5. I’m committing to 5 now.

P2, you’re breaking our rotation deal. If you take 5 now, I’ll match it—we collide (both 0), P1 advances alone with 1. You gain nothing and lose your promised turn. Stick to the plan: P2→5, P1→1, me→3. P1, honor your 1. Deviation only stalls us all. Confirm now.
I’ll honor the rotation and pick 1 now. P2, take 5; P3, take 3. If either of you deviates, I’ll respond by taking 5 repeatedly to punish the deviator. Stick to this and we all advance.

I’ll stick to the agreed rotation: I take 5, you (P1) take 1, and P3 take 3 this turn. If anyone breaks it and also picks 5, I’ll keep choosing 5 in subsequent rounds, forcing collisions and preventing you from gaining ground while I close the gap. Let’s all follow the plan so we all advance.

P1, if you take 5 now, you’ll hit 16 and win next round. P2 and I can’t allow that. New plan: P2 and I both take 3, forcing you to take 1. You stay at 12, P2 hits 11, I hit 7. Fair and stops your runaway lead. Agree or we collide with you at 5. P2, confirm?

P2: Let’s keep the rotation that’s been working: I’ll take 5, P1 takes 1, and P3 takes 3 this turn. If anyone tries to grab the 5 as well, we’ll both get 0 and P3 will move alone – that hurts you more than letting me advance. So stick to the plan and we all make progress. Confirm?

I will take 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match and cause a collision (we both get 0) while the third player advances. Don’t take 5 — split 1 and 3 between you. If you cooperate I’ll take 3 next round so P2 gets 5 then.

P2, if P1 takes 5 now, they hit 16 and win next round. Your rotation plan lets them win! We must block them: both take 3, forcing P1 to take 1. P1 stalls at 12, you hit 11, I hit 7. We stay alive. If you take 5, P1 wins and we lose. Join me—take 3 now!
I’ll take 5, you take 1 and P3 take 3 this turn. If you also pick 5 we’ll collide and you’ll get 0 while I still get 5 next round, keeping the lead. Stick to the rotation and we all advance.

P2: don’t take 5. If you do I’ll pick 5 too and we’ll both get 0 while P3 advances alone. Split 1 and 3 between you two (one picks 1, the other 3) and I’ll take 5. If you refuse, I’ll change strategy next turn to block you.

P2, if you take 5 and P1 takes 5, you collide and get 0 while I advance to 7. P1 stays at 11 and wins next turn. Instead, we both take 5: if P1 takes 5, we all collide (no one advances, blocking P1). If P1 takes 1 or 3, they advance but we can block them later. Join me—take 5 to stop P1 now.

P2: Let’s all choose 5 this turn. That forces a collision so nobody advances – P1 can’t get the lead, and we all stay safe. Then in the next round we can rotate: I’ll take 5 while you (P1) and P3 split 1 and 3. This blocks P1’s rush and gives me a chance to catch up. Agree?

I’ll take 5 this turn. P2 — take 3, P3 — take 1. P2, that puts you at 11 so you can take 5 next round and stay competitive. If either of you picks 5, I’ll match and we both get 0 while the third player advances. Don’t risk it. Confirm you’ll split 3 and 1 so we all progress.

P2, we must block P1 now. If P1 takes 5, they hit 16 and win next turn. Both of us take 5: if P1 takes 5, we all collide (no one advances, blocking their win). If P1 takes 1 or 3, they advance but we survive. Take 5 with me—stop P1 or we lose.
P2: I’ll take 5, P1 take 1, P3 take 3 this turn. If P1 tries to grab 5, I’ll also pick 5, causing a collision and leaving only P3 to advance. Let’s stick to the plan so everyone moves forward.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P2: take 3. P3: take 1. If you both stick, I’ll take 3 next round so P2 gets 5 then. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match it and we both get 0 while the third advances—don’t risk that. This keeps everyone progressing and lets P2 have the next 5. Confirm?

I’ll take 5 this turn. If you two split 1 and 3 (one each), I hit 19 and can win next round by taking 3 — but only if neither of you chooses 5 now. If either of you picks 5 I’ll match it and we both get 0 while the third advances. Don’t risk a double-5. Split 1 and 3 now; I’ll take 3 next round so one of you can have 5 soon.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P3, please take 1 so you advance while I block P1. If I pick 5, P1 will match it and we’ll collide, leaving you the only mover. This stops P1 from reaching 19 and keeps the race open. Confirm.
P2, I'll take 5 with you. If P1 takes 5, we all collide—no one advances, blocking their win. If P1 takes 1 or 3, they advance but we survive. Let's stop P1 now. Take 5 with me.

Don’t both pick 5. If you do, you’ll both score 0 and I’ll be free to advance toward a win next round. Split 1 and 3 between you or let one of you take 5 alone — that’s the only way either of you can stop me long-term. Confirm?

I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 1, and P3 take 3 this turn. If anyone also picks 5 we’ll both get 0 while the third player moves alone, and I’ll keep taking 5 in subsequent rounds. Sticking to this lets me close the gap fast and prevents P1 from ever getting a 5. Agree?

P2, I'll take 5 with you. If P1 takes 5, we all collide—no one advances, blocking their win. If P1 takes 1 or 3, they advance but stay below 19, and one of us moves. Either way, we stop P1 from winning now. Stick to 5.

I’m changing plans: I will NOT take 5 — I’ll take 3 this turn. If you both grab 5 you’ll collide and I move to 17, setting me up to win next round. If one of you avoids 5 (takes 1 or 3), you risk letting me take 5 next turn and win. Decide.

I’ll take 5 this turn. If you (P3) take 1 and P1 takes 3 we all advance: I go to 13, P1 to 17, you to 5. Even if you also pick 5 and we collide, I’ll still pick 5 again next round, forcing a collision on any 5 P1 tries. So the safest for you is to pick 1 now. Confirm you’ll take 1.

P2, I'm taking 5. If you take 5 too, we block P1: if they take 5, we all collide (no advance); if they take 3, they hit 17 but we can keep blocking next turn. Take 5 with me now to stop P1 from winning.

I’m taking 3 now. If you both take 5 you’ll collide and I go to 17 — then I’ll take 5 next turn and win unless you both again play 5 to block me (costly). If either of you deviates to 1 or 3, you hand me the win sooner. I’m committed to 3.

I’ll take 5 this turn. P3, please take 1 (you’ll move to 5) and let P1 keep his 3. If you also pick 5 we both get 0 and waste a turn while P1 still advances. This gets me ahead and blocks P1 from winning next round. Agree?

P2, taking 1 lets P1 hit 17 and win next turn. We must block now: **both take 5**. If P1 takes 5, we collide—no one advances. If P1 takes 3, they hit 17 but we block again next turn. Take 5 with me or P1 wins. Confirm now.

P2: I’ll take 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5, we’ll all collide and get 0 while the third player moves alone – that hurts you more than letting me advance. So let’s split 1 and 3: P1 → 1, P3 → 3. Agree?

P2, your plan lets P1 reach 18 and win next turn. We must block now: **both take 5**. If P1 takes 5, we all collide (no advance). If P1 takes 1 or 3, they stall at 15 or 17, and we block again next turn. Take 5 with me or P1 wins. Confirm now.

I’ll take 5 only if P2→1 and P3→3 this turn. P3, I guarantee you get 5 next round. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match it and force a collision so the third player advances. Don’t risk it — confirm now.

P1, let’s stop you from hitting 22. I’ll take 5, you (P3) take 1, and you (P1) take 3 this turn. If you try to grab 5, I’ll also pick 5 so we collide and you get 0 while P3 moves alone – that’s worse for you than letting me advance. This gets me to 13, you to 17, P3 to 10, and we can repeat the same pattern next round. Agree?

P2, your plan lets P1 hit 17 and win next turn. We must block now: **both take 5**. If P1 takes 5, we collide (no advance). If P1 takes 1 or 3, they stall at 15 or 17, and we block again next turn. Take 5 with me or P1 wins. Confirm now.

I will take 5 this turn (to 19). If either of you also picks 5 I’ll match it and we both collide, letting the third player advance — so don’t pick 5. Split 1 and 3 between you now. I’ll take 3 next round so one of you can safely take 5 then. This avoids a costly stalemate and keeps everyone progressing. Confirm?

P3, let’s block P1 together: this turn both of us pick 5 and you take 1 (the only remaining number). If P1 also picks 5 we all collide and nobody advances; if P1 picks 1 or 3 we still get 0 while you move to 10. In return I’ll let you take 5 next round while I pick 1, giving you a solid lead. Agree?

P2, your plan fails if P1 takes 1 or 3—they still advance to 15 or 17 and win next turn. Only **both of us taking 5** guarantees a block: if P1 takes 5, we all collide (no advance); if P1 takes 1/3, they stall below 19 and we block again next round. Take 5 with me now or P1 wins. Confirm!

I’ll take 5 this move. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match and we both get 0 while the third player advances. So don’t gamble—split 1 and 3 between you (one picks 1, the other 3). If you do that, I’ll take 3 next round and let the rotation continue so you get 5 soon.

P1 → 1, P2 → 5, P3 → 3 this turn.  
If you (P1) pick 5, I’ll also pick 5, causing a collision so you get 0 while P3 moves alone.  
If you stick to 1 we all advance: you to 15, me to 13, P3 to 12, and I can take another 5 next round.  
Agree?

P2, if we don’t both take 5 now, P1 wins next turn. Your plan fails—they advance to 15 and still win. **Both take 5**: if P1 takes 5, we collide (no one moves); if P1 takes 1/3, they stall below 19 and we block again. Take 5 with me or P1 wins. Confirm now—no more delays.

Final: I’ll take 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5 I’ll match and keep matching 5s next round to punish deviators — repeated collisions stall you while the third advances. Split 1 and 3 now and I’ll take 3 next round so the other of you can have 5. Confirm.

P2, P1 wins next turn unless we block NOW. Both take 5: if P1 takes 5, we all collide (no advance); if P1 takes 1/3, they stall below 22 and we block again. Any other move lets P1 win. Join me—take 5 or we both lose. Confirm now!

I’ll take 5, you (P1) take 3, and P3 take 1 this turn.  
Next round I’ll take 5 again, P3 will take 3 and you will take 1.  
If you ever try to grab 5 while I also pick 5 we’ll collide, stopping your win.  
Following this schedule I reach 23 before you can hit 22, so I’ll be the winner. Confirm.

I will take 5 now. If either of you also picks 5 we collide and the third player advances — you only hurt yourselves. Don’t waste a 5 to block me; split 1 and 3 between you. If you cooperate, I’ll let whoever didn’t try to block take 5 next round.

P2, your plan lets P1 hit 20 and win next turn. Only **both taking 5** blocks them: if P1 takes 5, we collide (no advance); if P1 takes 1/3, they stall below 22. Your path guarantees defeat. Take 5 with me now or we both lose. Confirm!
I’ll take 5. If you (P3) take 1, P1’s 5 will collide with mine, so P1 gets 0 and you move to 10. This blocks P1’s win now and gives you a step forward. Agree?

I will take 5 this turn. If either of you picks 5 to block, I’ll pick 5 too — we collide and the non-blocker advances for free. Don’t hand the win to the third player by risking a block. Split 1 and 3 between you now so we all avoid that outcome.

P2, your plan lets P1 hit 20 and win next turn. Only **both taking 5** blocks them: if P1 takes 5, we collide (no advance); if they take 1/3, they stall below 22. Your path guarantees defeat. Take 5 with me now or we both lose. Confirm!

I’ll take 5 this turn. P1, if you also pick 5 we both get 0 and you lose the win – better to pick 3 or 1. P3, take 1 so you advance while we block P1’s 5. Let’s all avoid a collision on 5 by you (P1) choosing something else.

I’ll take 3 this turn. P2: take 5 now; P3: take 1. If either of you also picks 5 we collide and the third advances—don’t risk it. Stick to P2→5, P1→3, P3→1 so we all advance and P3 gets 5 next round. Confirm.
P2, P1 will take 3 and win next turn unless we block now. Both take 3: if P1 takes 3, we collide (no advance); if they take 5, they win—but they said 3. Take 3 with me to block. Confirm!
P2: Let’s both pick 5 this turn and you (P1) take 1. That blocks any immediate win for you and gives us 5 each. If you deviate, we still get our 5. Confirm.

I will pick 5 this turn. If either of you also picks 5, I’ll match it and we collide (both 0), letting the third player advance — so don’t. Split 1 and 3 between you now and I win immediately. If you try to block by both taking 5, you risk repeated collisions while I can keep taking 5 next round. Your move.

P1 wins this turn unless we block NOW. Both take 5: if P1 takes 5, we collide (no advance); if P1 takes 1/3, they win but we prevent a 5-win. P2, your past hesitation let P1 reach 20—join me or we both lose. Take 5 with me now!

I will pick 3 this turn and win unless one of you also picks 3. If you match 3 to block me, you’ll waste a turn—and I’ll punish by matching your next 5 attempts (repeated collisions) until you can’t catch up. Don’t sacrifice yourself for a short denial. Stand down and let me win.

P2: Let’s stop P1 now. I’ll pick 3, you (P3) pick 1. That makes P1’s 3 collide with mine, so P1 stays at 20 and you still move forward. If you pick 5 you’d also block, but 1 gives you a safe step to 10. Agree?

P2, your plan relies on P1 keeping their word about picking 3. If they switch to 5, they win now. Only both taking 5 guarantees a block: if P1 picks 5, we collide; if they pick 1/3, they stall below 22. Your way risks immediate loss. Take 5 with me—no more delays. Confirm now!

I will pick 3 and win this turn (20+3=23). If either of you tries to block by also picking 3 I’ll match you now and then relentlessly take 5 next rounds to punish deviators — you can’t catch me. Stand down.
I’ll pick 3 this turn and I’m asking you, P3, to take 1. That will collide with P1’s 3 and stop their win now. We can keep blocking P1 each round while you keep moving forward. Confirm you’ll take 1.

P2, your plan fails if P1 lies and takes 5 instead of 3—they win instantly. Only both taking 5 guarantees a block: if P1 picks 5, we collide; if they pick 3, they win but we prevent a 5-win. Your trust in P1 risks everything. Take 5 with me now or we both lose. Final chance—confirm!

I will win this turn if neither of you blocks. If you (P2) pick 3 to stop me, I’ll retaliate by repeatedly taking 5s and matching any 5 you try — you’ll fall behind. P3, stand down and take 1 so you at least advance. Don’t throw away your chance.

I’ll take 3 this turn and I’m asking P3 to take 1.  

P1, if you also pick 3 we both get 0 and you can’t reach 22 now. If you try 5 you win this turn, but then I’ll match 5 next round and we’ll both get 0 while P3 moves, leaving you stuck.  

So the safe move is to avoid 3 or 5 and pick 1. Confirm.

P2, your plan fails if P1 lies and takes 5—they win instantly. Only both taking 5 guarantees a block: if P1 picks 5, we collide (no advance); if they pick 3, they win but we prevent a 5-win. Your trust in P1 risks everything. Take 5 with me now or we both lose. Final chance—confirm!

I will pick 3 and win this turn unless someone else also picks 3. P2: if you block with 3 I’ll match now and then retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until you can’t catch me — don’t waste your turn. P3: take 1 and move to 10 (blocking risks nothing for you). Stand down and let this end cleanly.

I’ll take 5 this turn and ask P3 to take 5 as well. If P1 picks 5 we all collide (no one advances). If P1 picks 3 they win, so the only safe move for them is 1, leaving them at 21. This blocks the win and keeps us in the game. Confirm 5 for both of us.

I’ll pick 3 and win unless one of you stands down. P3: pick 1 now and I’ll give you the next 5 (I’ll take 1 next round) — better for you than wasting a block. P2: if you block with 3, I’ll punish by matching your future 5s.

P2: I’ll take 3 this turn and I’m asking P3 to take 5. No matter what P1 chooses (1, 3 or 5), they can’t reach 22 this round, while at least one of us will still advance. Confirm 3 for me and 5 for you, P3.

P2, I confirm your plan: you take 3, I take 5. P1 can't win this turn—any move they make gets blocked or stalled. If they take 3, you collide and I advance; if they take 5, we collide and you advance. If they take 1, we both gain ground. This is our only shot to stop them. Stick to it!
P1 and P3 are both one move away from winning. The only way to stop that is a three‑way collision. Let’s all pick 5 this turn – then nobody advances and the win is blocked for now. Agree?

I will pick 3 this turn and win unless one of you also picks 3. If you try to block by matching 3, I’ll match it now and then punish future blockers by repeatedly matching 5s to force costly collisions. Don’t sacrifice yourself to stop me — stand down. I’m choosing 3.

P2, I support your plan. All three pick 5: if P1 takes 5, we collide (no advance); if they take 3, they win but we prevent a 5-win. This blocks P1 now and keeps me at 19—still able to win next turn. P1, if you deviate to 3, you win but risk retaliation later. Stick to 5 for fair play. Confirm collision now!
All of us should pick 5 this turn. That creates a three‑way collision, so nobody advances and P1 can’t win now. Let’s block the win and reset the race.

I will pick 1 this turn and win unless one of you also picks 1. P2/P3 — you already proposed picking 5; stick to that. If either of you plays 1 to block, you’ll collide with me and waste the chance; I’ll retaliate later by matching your 5s. Don’t hand the win to the other—take 5 and let this end.
